title: New Cabinet to take oaths tomorrow
content:
The Cabinet of Ministers of the new Government is scheduled to take oaths tomorrow. Three Ministers earlier took oaths before the President. 
The United National Party succeeded in achieving a five sixths majority in Parliament in the General Election held in the year 1978.The United National Party Government headed by J.R. Jayawardena adopted a new Constitution thereafter and  introduced an Executive Presidential system. From then onwards Sri Lanka embarked on a Democratic Socialist Republic political journey based on that Constitution. 
It was the first Parliament of the Sri Lanka Democratic Socialist Republic which commenced in 1978. Thereafter the Parliaments met in 1989, 1984, 2000, 2001, 2004 and 2010. It is the eighth Parliament that has now been elected. 
The Cabinet of Ministers of the new National Government is due to take oaths before President Maithripala Sirisena tomorrow. Various views had been expressed on the composition of the new Cabinet. It has been agreed to limit the number of Cabinet Ministerial Portfolios to 48 and the number of State Ministers and Deputy Ministers to 45.
